readingOnHtml: <primary>せい</primary>, しょう, じょう
sourceMeaningMnemonic: It's <radical>correct</radical> in <radical>winter</radical> to focus on <kanji>politics</kanji> and the <kanji>government</kanji>. Elections are happening, in the new year politicians are being sworn in. Winter is government time!
meaningInfo: Imagine all this politics and government talk as you shiver outside in the winter cold. You’re freezing and you’re bored, but you know this is the right (correct) thing to do.
readingMnemonic: Everyone involved in <kanji>politics</kanji> and <kanji>government</kanji> wields a special <reading>sa</reading>ber (<ja>せい</ja>). If two political parties are arguing, they'll whip out their sabers and start slashing away!
readingInfo: Picture two different politicians, both wielding sabers, fighting to make the government the way they want it to be! Who are you rooting for?
